text:
Try to setup a Load test facility to with 5 system, 4 as JMeter engine and 1 as
Controller. The 4 system has 2 NIC's and the Controller PC only has one NIC. The
5 PC's has connected as local network with private IP address (192.168.0.x), the
JMeter engine PC's connected to the Corp. network with the DHCP to get the ip.
The JMeter properties file has the 192.168.0.x address for the controller pc.
When the test executed in remote testing I get the error as connection refused
from ip 10.34.36.x (the Corp. LAN ip address). If I connect the all 5 PC's to
the Corp. LAN the testing works, however I want to reduce the JMeter traffic on
the Corp. LAN by using the Local Network.

The following is the error from controller system (Client)

text:
this is a limitation of RMI. the only practical way around it is to use a RMI
server that supports multiple subnets.
